title: Traitor Winds: A Beta Sector Novel
features: The President of the Unified Collaboration of Systems, along with hundreds of the civilians, had been ruthlessly murdered. There was little need to speculate who had done it—for the instigator was quick to take full credit for the act:The renegade Sector Command Admiral, Maros Krador.While Sector Command forces search in vain for the traitor, Krador begins to amass a fleet of warships from a secret base, setting himself on a course that is sure to leave a wake of destruction throughout the entire Beta Sector.The last team of elite covert agents sent in to eliminate Krador was never seen again, yet the Unified Council and the secretive Office of Special Investigations knew what needed to be done. They would need to try again...and there was only one agent they could trust to get the job done.Unfortunately, Angelika Jordan wanted nothing to do with it. Set several years prior to the events of the Kestrel Saga, Beta Sector is a series of stand-alone novels that chronicle adventures taking place during the Great Galactic War between the Unified Collaboration of Systems and the Kafaran Alliance in the mid-24th century.

is an area of space far beyond the confines of our current solar system. Hundreds of years from now, this area has been both explored and colonized by human and alien races.Pirates,smugglers, militaries (some friendly, some fiercely protective of their domains) and civilizations both primitive and advanced abound in Beta Sector. Full of wondrous sights, discoveries, and riches beyond the imagination, Beta Sector is also called "home" by those who would quickly dispatch trespassers and would-be adventurers who make a single miscalculation.A detailed map of
can be downloaded for free from the publishers website.

Born and raised in Southern California, Stephen A. Fender joined the Navy at the age of 18, where he proudly served for five years. He is now a full-time computer programmer and graphic designer.Stephen lives in the beautiful Pacific Northwest with his wife, where he enjoys boating, hiking, spending time with his wonderful family, and taking the time each day to remember life isn't all about work.
